title: African Landmarks Quiz
description: Explore the diverse and fascinating landmarks of Africa, from ancient pyramids to natural wonders.

questions.question: The Great Pyramid of Giza, the oldest of the Seven Wonders of the Ancient World, was built as a tomb for which pharaoh?
Victoria Falls, one of the largest waterfalls in the world, sits on the border between Zambia and which other country?
Table Mountain, a flat-topped mountain that is a prominent landmark, overlooks which South African city?
The Rock-Hewn Churches of Lalibela, carved from solid rock in the 12th century, are located in which country?
The Serengeti National Park, famous for the Great Migration of wildebeest, is located in which country?
The Hassan II Mosque in Casablanca features the tallest minaret in the world. How tall is it?
Mount Kilimanjaro, Africa's tallest peak, is located in which country?
The Valley of the Kings, containing tombs of pharaohs including Tutankhamun, is near which Egyptian city?
Robben Island, where Nelson Mandela was imprisoned for 18 years, is located off the coast of which city?
The Avenue of the Baobabs, a famous group of towering baobab trees, is located in which island nation?
Timbuktu, once a major center of Islamic learning, is located in which West African country?
The Ngorongoro Crater, the world's largest inactive and intact volcanic caldera, is located in which country?
The Temple of Abu Simbel, featuring four colossal statues of Ramses II, was relocated in the 1960s to save it from which dam's reservoir?
The Djinguereber Mosque, one of three ancient mosques in Timbuktu, was built from which primary material?
Fish River Canyon, the second-largest canyon in the world, is located in which Southern African country?
